It looks like Bow (http://www-2.cs.cmu.edu/~mccallum/bow/) wants to look 
at content, not links.  Is that right?  Or is it that your classifier 
just looks at links?  If its looking at links only, then you'd override 
the PostSelector, the processor that schedules links with the Frontier, 
so that you could do a JNI call out to Bow to ask it if a link should be 
scheduled, or you could add a new Processor into the Post-Processing 
Chain (http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual.html#N1012B) 
that happened before the PostSelector and in here knock out URLs you 
don't want crawled.   If you need to feed Bow the page content, you'd 
write a new Processor that passed Bow via JNI the file on disk that had 
the downloaded document (We might need to do a little work in Heritrix 
because we usually keep the request in memory only spooling to disk if 
the request is 'large').    Bow would do its thing and return a score 
back across the JNI bridge.  Your BowProcessor would check the score 
against a configurable boundary.  This new BowProcessor could be 
inserted into the Heritrix extractor processing step before all other 
extractors.  If the returned value was above the boundary score, then 
you'd let the page through to the extractors for links to be found; 
otherwise, you'd skip the extractors so no URLs would be pulled from 
this page.  Or you'd package your processor as a filter for the 
ARCWriter step and if the score was below the configured threshold, 
you'd not write the page into the ARCs.

Maybe you'd combinations of the above?

Let us know how we can help.  Integrating such a classifier would be a 
nice feather in Heritrix's cap.

St.Ack



Saurabh Pathak wrote:

>
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> > The focusing dials on Heritrix are in synopsis:
> >
> > - Scope (Domain, Host, Path, etc.)
> > - Filters (Regex on URL, Regex on Content-Type, etc.).
> > - Size of response, time to complete response.
> >
> > Sounds like you want a 'classification dial' of some sort.  Can you
> > describe what this classifier would do?
>
> Thanks for your reply Stack. I dont think scope or filter dials are
> sufficient to meet my purpose.
>
> Here is a brief description of what I want to do,
>
> I want to build a crawl collection for a topic and hence I need to
> run a focused crawl instead of a normal crawl. I have trained the Bow
> classifier to recognize pages relevant to the topic. Now I want to
> hook up this trained classifier to  Heritrix in such a manner that
> Heritrix consults this classifer before following any link. In short I
> want to add a URL to frontier only if it belongs to the topic (if the
> score returned by the classifier meets a minimum threshold value) 
>
> Is there a way to accomplish above task?
> please let me know if anything is still unclear or not properly
> explained by me.
>
> Best,
>
> Saurabh
